alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 10:52PM MST until further notice by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Cornville affecting Yavapai County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Cornville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flooding begins to inundate lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 8.0 feet, Flooding of lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 9.0 feet, Hiking trails along banks of creek affected. Portions of residential yards flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:31 PM MST Wednesday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage later tonight and continue falling through Thursday. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Oak Creek Cornville 8.0 8.5 Wed 10 pm MST 4.9 3.8 3.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
